trans-unit.source: Deploy a Linux application using the Azure CustomScript Extension
trans-unit.target: Deploy a Linux application using the Azure CustomScript Extension

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Azure CustomScript extension to deploy applications on Linux virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Azure CustomScript extension to deploy applications on Linux virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure CustomScript Extension for Linux provides a way to customize your virtual machines (VMs) by running arbitrary code written in any scripting language supported by the VM (for example, Python, and Bash).
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure CustomScript Extension for Linux provides a way to customize your virtual machines (VMs) by running arbitrary code written in any scripting language supported by the VM (for example, Python, and Bash).

trans-unit.source: This provides a very flexible way to automate application deployment to multiple machines.
trans-unit.target: This provides a very flexible way to automate application deployment to multiple machines.

trans-unit.source: You can deploy the CustomScript Extension using the Azure Portal, Windows PowerShell, or the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).
trans-unit.target: You can deploy the CustomScript Extension using the Azure Portal, Windows PowerShell, or the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI).

trans-unit.source: In this article we'll deploy a simple LAMP application to Ubuntu using the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: In this article we'll deploy a simple LAMP application to Ubuntu using the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For the next example, first create two Azure VMs running Ubuntu 14.04.
trans-unit.target: For the next example, first create two Azure VMs running Ubuntu 14.04.

trans-unit.source: The VMs are called script-vm and lamp-vm.
trans-unit.target: The VMs are called script-vm and lamp-vm.

trans-unit.source: Use unique names when you create the VMs.
trans-unit.target: Use unique names when you create the VMs.

trans-unit.source: One is used to run the CLI commands and one is used to deploy the LAMP app.
trans-unit.target: One is used to run the CLI commands and one is used to deploy the LAMP app.

trans-unit.source: You also need an Azure Storage account and a key to access it (you can get this from the Azure Portal).
trans-unit.target: You also need an Azure Storage account and a key to access it (you can get this from the Azure Portal).

trans-unit.source: If you need help creating Linux VMs on Azure refer to <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need help creating Linux VMs on Azure refer to <linkText>Create a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The install commands assume Ubuntu, but you can adapt the installation for any supported Linux distro.
trans-unit.target: The install commands assume Ubuntu, but you can adapt the installation for any supported Linux distro.

trans-unit.source: The script-vm VM needs to have Azure CLI installed, with a working connection to Azure.
trans-unit.target: The script-vm VM needs to have Azure CLI installed, with a working connection to Azure.

trans-unit.source: For help with this refer to <linkText>Install and Configure the Azure Command-Line Interface</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For help with this refer to <linkText>Install and Configure the Azure Command-Line Interface</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this example the CustomScript Extension runs a script on a remote VM to install the LAMP stack and create a PHP page.
trans-unit.target: In this example the CustomScript Extension runs a script on a remote VM to install the LAMP stack and create a PHP page.

trans-unit.source: In order to access the script from anywhere we'll upload it as an Azure blob.
trans-unit.target: In order to access the script from anywhere we'll upload it as an Azure blob.

trans-unit.source: The next script example installs a LAMP stack to Ubuntu (including setting up a silent install of MySQL), writes a simple PHP file, and starts Apache.
trans-unit.target: The next script example installs a LAMP stack to Ubuntu (including setting up a silent install of MySQL), writes a simple PHP file, and starts Apache.

trans-unit.source: Save the script as a text file, for example lamp_install.sh, and then upload it to Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Save the script as a text file, for example lamp_install.sh, and then upload it to Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: You can do this easily with Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: You can do this easily with Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: The following example uploads the file to a storage container named "scripts".
trans-unit.target: The following example uploads the file to a storage container named "scripts".

trans-unit.source: If the container doesn't exist you'll need to create it first.
trans-unit.target: If the container doesn't exist you'll need to create it first.

trans-unit.source: Also create a JSON file that describes how to download the script from Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Also create a JSON file that describes how to download the script from Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Save this as public_config.json (replacing "mystorage" with the name of your storage account):
trans-unit.target: Save this as public_config.json (replacing "mystorage" with the name of your storage account):

trans-unit.source: Now you can use the next command to deploy the Linux CustomScript Extension to the remote VM using the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Now you can use the next command to deploy the Linux CustomScript Extension to the remote VM using the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: The previous command downloads and runs the lamp_install.sh script on the VM called lamp-vm.
trans-unit.target: The previous command downloads and runs the lamp_install.sh script on the VM called lamp-vm.

trans-unit.source: Since the app includes a web server, remember to open an HTTP listening port on the remote VM with the next command.
trans-unit.target: Since the app includes a web server, remember to open an HTTP listening port on the remote VM with the next command.

trans-unit.source: You can check on how well the custom script runs by looking at the log file on the remote VM.
trans-unit.target: You can check on how well the custom script runs by looking at the log file on the remote VM.

trans-unit.source: SSH to lamp-vm and tail the log file with the next command.
trans-unit.target: SSH to lamp-vm and tail the log file with the next command.

trans-unit.source: After you run the CustomScript Extension, you can browse to the PHP page you created for information.
trans-unit.target: After you run the CustomScript Extension, you can browse to the PHP page you created for information.

trans-unit.source: The PHP page for the example in this article is http://lamp-vm.cloudapp.net/phpinfo.php.
trans-unit.target: The PHP page for the example in this article is http://lamp-vm.cloudapp.net/phpinfo.php.

trans-unit.source: You can use the same basic steps to deploy more complex apps.
trans-unit.target: You can use the same basic steps to deploy more complex apps.

trans-unit.source: In this example the install script was saved as a public blob in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: In this example the install script was saved as a public blob in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: A more secure option would be to store the install script as a secure blob with a <linkText>Secure Access Signature</linkText><title></title> (SAS).
trans-unit.target: A more secure option would be to store the install script as a secure blob with a <linkText>Secure Access Signature</linkText><title></title> (SAS).

trans-unit.source: Additional resources for Azure CLI, Linux and the CustomScript Extension are listed next.
trans-unit.target: Additional resources for Azure CLI, Linux and the CustomScript Extension are listed next.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automate Linux VM Customization Tasks Using CustomScript Extension</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Linux and Open-Source Computing on Azure</linkText><title></title>
